<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 171, 183, 188]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 247, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 321]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 338, 228, 353]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 354, 912, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 533, 220, 548]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 808, 597]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 912, 91]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a pendulum. The pendulum bob swings repeatedly between points M and N.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 100, 579, 233]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 246, 616, 265]]<|/det|>
A student starts a stop-watch when the bob reaches point M.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 275, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
He counts each time the bob changes direction and stops the watch on the tenth change in direction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 320, 455, 339]]<|/det|>
The watch shows a time of 12.0 seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 350, 418, 369]]<|/det|>
What is the period of the pendulum?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 378, 134, 396]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 378, 201, 396]]<|/det|>
0.60 s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[281, 378, 303, 396]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 378, 361, 396]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 378, 470, 396]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 378, 527, 396]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 378, 705, 396]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 422, 96, 443]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 422, 484, 443]]<|/det|>
The speed–time graph represents a journey.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[270, 450, 725, 640]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 653, 920, 688]]<|/det|>
How does the graph show that the distance travelled in section X of the journey is greater than the distance travelled in section Y?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 696, 133, 715]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 696, 806, 715]]<|/det|>
The area below section X of the graph is greater than the area below section Y.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 723, 133, 741]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 723, 801, 741]]<|/det|>
The gradient of section X of the graph is greater than the gradient of section Y.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 750, 133, 768]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 750, 920, 784]]<|/det|>
The speed at the end of section X of the journey is greater than the speed at the end of section Y.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 790, 133, 809]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 790, 761, 809]]<|/det|>
The time for section X of the journey is greater than the time for section Y.

<label>14</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 739, 920, 771]]<|/det|>
On a warm day, a driver checks the air pressure in a car tyre. At night, the temperature drops and the air pressure in the tyre decreases. There are no air leaks in the tyre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 784, 401, 801]]<|/det|>
Why does the pressure decrease?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 812, 134, 829]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 812, 546, 829]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 839, 133, 856]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 839, 500, 856]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 866, 133, 883]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 866, 510, 883]]<|/det|>
The volume of the air in the tyre decreases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 892, 133, 910]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 892, 507, 910]]<|/det|>
The volume of the air in the tyre increases.

<label>18</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 677, 91]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four rods. Each rod is made of a different metal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 456, 445, 473]]<|/det|>
A Silver is the best conductor of heat.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 483, 453, 500]]<|/det|>
B Silver is the worst conductor of heat.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 508, 430, 526]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 535, 433, 552]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 578, 106, 596]]<|/det|>
<label>19</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 578, 520, 596]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a pan of water being heated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 607, 576, 626]]<|/det|>
After a short time, all the water in the pan begins to boil.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 633, 603, 740]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 753, 806, 772]]<|/det|>
What is the main process by which thermal energy is transferred through the water?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 783, 141, 801]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 783, 245, 800]]<|/det|>
conduction

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 810, 141, 828]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 810, 245, 827]]<|/det|>
convection

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 836, 248, 854]]<|/det|>
C evaporation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 863, 141, 880]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>
